title: LGBTQ+ Advocacy Day
description: Join LGBTQ+ leaders and allies from across Illinois for advocacy training on key LGBTQ+ legislative priorities and the opportunity to meet with state lawmakers. Together, we can drive progress, tackle systemic challenges, and advance LGBTQ+ rights. This is a vital opportunity to unite, take action, and make our voices heard.
raw_text:
2025
LGBTQ+ ADVOCACY DAY
Thursday, May 8th, 2025
Illinois State Capitol, Springfield, IL
JOIN US FOR LGBTQ+ ADVOCACY DAY!
Now more than ever, we must take action. Join LGBTQ+ leaders and allies from across Illinois for advocacy training on key LGBTQ+ legislative priorities and the opportunity to meet with state lawmakers. Together, we can drive progress, tackle systemic challenges, and advance LGBTQ+ rights. This event is a vital opportunity to unite, take action, and make our voices heard.
EQUALITY ILLINOIS
TOGETHER WE WILL
REGISTER TODAY!
[QR Code]

title: Cherry Hill Tesla Takedown
description: We are taking nonviolent action to oppose Tesla's practices and prevent what is seen as an illegal coup by Elon Musk. The protest includes selling Teslas, dumping stock, and joining picket lines to stop Musk and protect democracy.
raw_text:
Cherry Hill Tesla Takedown

Start: Saturday, May 10, 2025 • 12:30 PM
Cherry Hill Tesla Showroom • 1605, Cherry Hill, NJ 08002
US

Elon Musk is destroying our democracy, and he's using the fortune he built at Tesla to do it. We are taking nonviolent action at Tesla to stop Musk's illegal coup.

⚡ Sell your Teslas, dump your stock, join the picket lines.
⚡ We're tanking Tesla's stock price to stop Musk.
⚡ Stopping Musk will help save lives and protect our democracy.

The stakes couldn’t be higher. No one is coming to save us.
Not politicians, not the media, not the courts.

Tesla Takedown is a peaceful protest movement. We oppose violence, vandalism and destruction of property. This protest is a lawful exercise of our First Amendment right to peaceful assembly.
raw_summary: A protest event titled 'Cherry Hill Tesla Takedown' is scheduled on Saturday, May 10, 2025, at 12:30 PM at the Cherry Hill Tesla Showroom, New Jersey. The protest aims to oppose Tesla and its practices by taking nonviolent actions.

title: Using Joy to Organize and Change Communities - Rescheduled!
description: Join us to explore the influence of historical women leaders on current community organizing, led by Jillian Gaeta. Engage in discussions, learn history, and enjoy social time.
raw_text:
Using Joy to Organize and Change Communities - Rescheduled!

Badass women in history have always leaned into joy, creativity and community to bring change and push through difficult times. Actions by strong women leaders from the Civil Rights movement, the Black Panther Party and Women’s Rights organizers can help inspire us as we stand up for our rights today! Join us to learn this history and let’s discuss how we can successfully take their lessons of joy and community to make a difference right now.

Jillian Gaeta, historian, professor, and co-founder of Roots to Revolution will share her perspectives and engage us in conversation to sustain and inspire us as we find ways to create the world we want! Donations to the non-profit Roots to Revolution will be accepted.

We'll be there from 6:15 to 7:00 for beer, and social time! Bring your own food or order from local restaurants who deliver!

Best parking is in the municipal lot off Morris, the Lafayette Garage by the train, the Vail lot, or on Dehart. Each lot is about a 10 minute walk to the brewery. We will be upstairs in the General's Quarters (steps only for access). No outside beverages.

12 Attendees
Hosted by
Kathleen C.

STARTS ON
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 at 6:15 PM EDT
ENDS ON
Tuesday, May 13, 2025 at 8:45 PM EDT

Glenbrook Brewery
95 Morris Street
Morristown, NJ, 07960
United States
Get Directions via Google Maps

It features Jillian Gaeta discussing perspectives related to civil rights movements and community organization. The event will take place at Glenbrook Brewery in Morristown, NJ, on May 13, 2025, with social time included.

title: Central NJ: Hands Off Our Planet! Town Hall
description: We are hosting a town hall in Highland Park to address climate challenges and potential solutions, including the NJ Climate Superfund Act. Join us to engage with state and municipal leaders, hear stories from impacted community members, and learn how you can take action for critical policy solutions in New Jersey.
raw_text:
Central NJ: Hands Off Our Planet! Town Hall
Town Hall * Hosted by Food & Water Watch

Earth Day Town Hall Series
HANDS OFF OUR PLANET!
Confronting the Climate and Affordability Crises in NJ
Make Polluters Pay!

May 15 THURSDAY
MIDDLESEX COUNTY
Reformed Church of Highland Park
7:00 - 8:30 PM

Time
Thursday, May 15
7 – 8:30pm EDT

Location
Reformed Church of Highland Park
19 S 2nd Ave
Highland Park, NJ 08904
Map

About this event
Central Jersey Empower NJ Town Hall: Confronting the Climate and Affordability Crises

With unprecedented federal attacks on climate science, the gutting of federal protections for clean air and water, and the attempt to eliminate funding for emergency response to climate disasters, we need our elected officials in New Jersey to fill the leadership void. These attacks are happening as working families across our state are already struggling to keep up with the rising costs of healthcare, insurance, housing, and utilities, and as the damages from extreme storms, flooding, heatwaves, and wildfires continue increasing.

Join us in Highland Park for a town hall on these challenges and potential solutions — like the NJ Climate Superfund Act, which would ensure that the world's wealthiest fossil fuel corporations, not taxpayers, foot the bill for climate disasters.

We’ll be joined by members of our state legislature who are co-sponsoring the NJ Climate Superfund Act as well as municipal leaders who have taken local action in support of this bill. We’ll also hear from community members who have been impacted by the climate crisis, local climate and environmental leaders, and more.

Join us to learn about these issues and how you can take action to support critical policy solutions that invest in our health, environment, and economy here in New Jersey!
raw_summary: The flyer promotes a town hall event in Central New Jersey, focusing on climate and affordability crises, hosted by Food & Water Watch, to discuss policy solutions and actions against environmental issues.

title: Protest Outside Gabe Evans' Office
description: There is a weekly protest outside of Representative Gabe Evans' Office every Friday at 11 am. This is a chance for constituents to express their concerns about his voting record and how it impacts them and their families. Participants are encouraged to leave letters and engage in peaceful, respectful protest.
raw_text:
Protest Outside Gabe Evans' Office

Friday, 16 May
11:00 am - 12:00 pm
10701 Melody Dr suite 500, Northglenn, CO 80234, USA

Are you in CD8? There is a weekly protest outside of Representative Gabe Evans' Office every Friday at 11 am. This would also be a great time to visit the staff and express your concerns about the impact of his votes on you, your family and your friends. Leave a letter letting him know how he can vote to best represent you!

These protests are peaceful. Be angry! Be loud! But be respectful and non-violent.

www.indivisiblenoco.com
raw_summary: A flyer advertising a weekly peaceful protest outside Representative Gabe Evans' office every Friday at 11 am. The protest is held at 10701 Melody Dr, suite 500, Northglenn, CO 80234. Attendees are encouraged to visit the staff and express concerns about his votes.

title: Visibility Brigade and Operation Activate Letter and Poster Making Event!
description: Join us to make additional letters, numbers, and symbols for our Visibility Brigade! Participate in Operation Activate, creating posters to reach commuters at train stations and other sites.
address: Chester Public Library, 250 West Main Street
raw_text:
Visibility Brigade and Operation Activate Letter and Poster Making Event!

Join us to make additional letters, numbers and symbols needed for our Visibility Brigade!

Now that we have been operating for awhile, we realize we could use more boards with some symbols like &, $, numbers, etc.

Also, we are going to start participating in Operation Activate! An effort to reach commuters at train stations, bus depots and park and rides! We will make posters to support that effort AND you can also make posters for your OWN rally poster needs.

Please register so please know how many supplies to purchase!

13 Attendees

Hosted by Kathleen C.

STARTS ON
Saturday, May 17, 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT
ENDS ON
Saturday, May 17, 2025 at 3:00 PM EDT

Chester Public Library
250 West Main Street
Chester, NJ, 07930
United States

title: Save Our Trees!
description: Join us in protesting the actions being taken by President Trump, Elon Musk, and DOGE to dismantle systems meant to protect our planet from climate change and other environmental threats.
raw_text:
Save Our Trees!

Join us in protesting the actions being taken by President Trump, Elon Musk, and DOGE to dismantle systems meant to protect our planet from climate change and other environmental threats.

Actions taken By the Trump Administration on the Topic of Climate Change:
- Leaving the Paris Climate Agreement
- EPA rolling back climate regulations
- Increased logging in National Forests
- Rolling back vehicle emission standards
- Loosening restrictions on CO2 produced by power plants
- Mass firing of National Park Rangers
- Suspending Climate Change Research

May 18, 2025
12-2 PM
Utah Capitol Building-South Steps
raw_summary: The flyer announces a protest event titled 'Save Our Trees!' aimed at protesting actions taken by President Trump, Elon Musk, and DOGE. The protest is against dismantling systems that protect the environment. The flyer lists specific actions taken by the Trump Administration regarding climate change that the protest aims to oppose.

title: Hands Across Chicagoland
description: We will form a human chain of conscience across Chicagoland in peaceful protest against Trump’s illegal and authoritarian actions. We will line sidewalks from Aurora to Douglass Park along Ogden, 26th Street, and California. This is a peaceful protest. We will not block streets or businesses along the route. Bring signs, wear black, and make some noise!
address: From Aurora to Douglass Park along Ogden, 26th Street, and California
raw_text:
JOIN HANDS.
SPEAK OUT.
DEFEND DEMOCRACY.

HANDS ACROSS CHICAGOLAND

SUNDAY, MAY 18 * 12:00 PM – 2:00 PM

We will form a human chain of conscience across Chicagoland in peaceful protest against Trump's illegal and authoritarian actions.

We will line sidewalks from Aurora to Douglass Park along Ogden, 26th Street, and California.

This is a peaceful protest. We will not block streets or businesses along the route.

Bring signs, wear black, and make some noise!

More coming soon at handsacrosschi.com
* Get an assigned location along the route
* List of partner organizations
* Additional event info

RSVP

title: March with Garden State Equality
description: Join the Garden State Equality team as we kick off the 2025 PRIDE season. We'll meet in front of our new headquarters at 308 Main Street across from the Municipal building. March with us and visit our table during the festival from 12-7pm.
raw_text:
March with Garden State Equality
Community Event - Hosted by Garden State Equality

[Image of flag]

Time
Sunday, June 1
10:45am – 12pm EDT

Location
308 Main St
Asbury Park, NJ 07712

Map

About this event
Join the Garden State Equality team as we kick off the 2025 PRIDE season!
We'll meet in front of our new headquarters at 308 Main Street across from the Municipal building, and yes, we will be walking with our Garden State Equality mobile this year! To march for equality with us please arrive at our building at 10:45AM.
Though the parade ends at noon, we encourage you to stick around and visit our table during the rest of the festival from 12-7pm!

There is no cost to join us for the parade in the morning. You can purchase tickets for the festival here: https://jerseypride.org/
raw_summary: The image promotes a community march event hosted by Garden State Equality to kick off the 2025 Pride season, scheduled for June 1st. The event will take place at 308 Main St, Asbury Park, NJ, and includes marching until noon and continuation of activities until 7 PM. Additional details on participation and festival tickets are provided.

description: Join us for the "Patriot Protest," a non-violent day of action on the 4th of July in Washington D.C. By, for, and of the people!
raw_text:
PATRIOT PROTEST
4TH OF JULY
WASHINGTON D.C.
SPREAD THE NEWS!
NON-VIOLENT DAY OF ACTION
BY, FOR, AND OF THE PEOPLE!
raw_summary: The flyer is promoting a protest named "Patriot Protest" scheduled for the 4th of July in Washington D.C. It emphasizes a non-violent day of action by, for, and of the people, urging participants to spread the news.

title: March for Integrity
description: Join our movement to end citizens united. We aim to remove money from politics and restore integrity.
raw_text:
MONEY OUT OF POLITICS
MARCH FOR INTEGRITY
JULY 27TH 2025 • WASHINGTON D.C.
JOIN THE MOVEMENT - END CITIZENS UNITED!
MONEYOUTOFPOLITICS.ORG
SCAN QR CODE TO LEARN MORE
#ExposeTheElite #BanCorporateMoney #CongressCorruption #PeopleOverProfits #VeteransDeserveBetter
raw_summary: The image describes an event called 'March for Integrity' scheduled for July 27, 2025, in Washington D.C. The event is about ending the influence of money in politics with a call to 'End Citizens United.'

title: March for Integrity
description: Join us in Washington, DC for the March for Integrity to advocate for veterans' rights, campaign finance reform, and trust in Congress. Let’s make our voices heard.
raw_text:
27 JULY 2025
MARCH FOR INTEGRITY
#VETERANSDESERVEBETTER
#MONEYOUTOFPOLITICS
#PASSTRUSTINCONGRESSACT
WASHINGTON DC
GET ACTIVE ● JOIN THE MOVEMENT
SCAN HERE TO SAVE OUR DEMOCRACY
raw_summary: The image promotes the 'March for Integrity' event occurring on July 27, 2025, in Washington, DC, focusing on issues like veterans' rights, political financing, and trust in Congress. Hashtags indicate support for integrity and activism.

title: Christmas Wonderland Market
description: Join us for a festive day of holiday shopping, food, and fun.
raw_text:
Christmas Wonderland Market
Join us for a festive day of holiday shopping, food, and fun
Location: Riverside Park, 123 River Rd, Springfield
Date: December 15, 2025
Time: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM
Hosted by: Springfield Community Center
raw_summary: The image contains details about an event, namely the "Christmas Wonderland Market," which provides an opportunity for attendees to shop for holiday gifts from various vendors and enjoy festive activities and cuisine.
